headline: Newt Gingrich predicts GOP could pick up historic 70 House seats
author: Daniel Chaitin
sentences: Speaking of a towering "tsunami" and improved support among Hispanics, Gingrich also argued Democratic candidates who reside in districts won by President Joe Biden in 2020 by double-digit margins are in jeopardy.

The former House speaker predicts Republicans could pick up as many as 70 seats in the House in the midterm elections, as well as four in the Senate, returning control of both chambers of Congress to the GOP.

In the House, that would top the 63-seat gain by Republicans in 2010, the height of the Tea Party movement and the highest gain for both parties since 1948, notes the Washington Examiner's Paul Bedard.
Former NFL player Herschel Walker, who is running for Senate in Georgia, where Gingrich used to be a congressman, was one GOP candidate he highlighted.
"In addition, I would say that if youre in a district that Biden carried by less than 15 or 20 points, youre in great danger as a Democrat," he said.
We'll probably pick up about four seats in the Senate," Gingrich told Maria Bartiromo on her Fox News show Sunday Morning Futures.
Gingrich also predicted Rep. Kevin McCarthy, who is facing a leaked tape controversy, will go on to be House speaker.
In the Senate, Democrats and two independents have control, with Vice President Kamala Harris as a tiebreaker.
"I think that people like Herschel Walker are going to do very, very well," he said.
Democrats currently have a dozen more seats in the House than the Republicans.
Newt Gingrich is forecasting what could be a historic red wave this November.
"I think well pick up between 25 and 70 seats in the House.
"I think he will do an amazingly good job," he said.
